avdta.gui.editor.visual.rules

Class NodeTypeRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.gui.editor.visual.rules.NodeRule
      • avdta.gui.editor.visual.rules.NodeTypeRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class NodeTypeRule
extends NodeRule
    The NodeTypeRule color-codes Nodes of a specified type. The type is fairly complicated because it can refer to the Node class, the intersection control, or the intersection policy. The types used are specified by EditNode.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeTypeRule

        public NodeTypeRule()
        Creates a NodeTypeRule that matches centroids.

      • NodeTypeRule

        public NodeTypeRule(int type,
                    int control,
                    int policy,
                    java.awt.Color color,
                    int width)
        Constructs this NodeTypeRule for the given type matching. See EditNode for types.
        Parameters:
        type - the class of node (centroid/intersection)
        control - the type of control (signals, reservations, etc.)
        policy - the policy (FCFS, backpressure, etc.)
        color - the fill color used to display these types of nodes
        width - the radius (px)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns a String specifying the type of Nodes matched by this NodeTypeRule. This may correspond to the class of Node (centroid/intersection), the intersection control (signals, reservations, etc.), or the policy (FCFS, backpressure, etc.).
        Specified by:
        getName in class NodeRule
        Returns:
        a String specifying the type of Nodes matched by this NodeTypeRule
